Article.Abstract: CD8(+)-T-cell (T(CD8+)) responses to infectious viruses are characterized by an immunodominance hierarchy in which the majority of T(CD8+) respond to one or a few immunodominant determinants, with a minority of T(CD8+) responding to a number of subdominant determinants. It is now well established that exogenous antigens are capable of inducing T(CD8+) to such immunodominant determinants, but the diversity of the response and the nature of the immunodominance hierarchy have not been examined. We addressed this issue by characterizing T(CD8+) responses to influenza virus preparations rendered inert by incubation for 10 min at 100 degrees C, as first reported by Speidel et al. (Eur. J. Immunol. 27:2391-2399, 1997). Extending these findings, we show that the primary T(CD8+) response to boiled virus can be sufficiently robust to be detected ex vivo by intracellular cytokine staining and that the response encompasses many of the peptides recognized by T(CD8+) induced by infectious virus. Importantly, the immunodominance hierarchy elicited was leveled, and we were unable to detect T(CD8+) that were specific for boiled virus. We used peritoneal exudate cells as antigen-presenting cells in vitro, and a number of observations indicated that boiled virus is processed via a phagocytic route that is likely to be endosomal in nature. These findings suggest that the repertoires of immunogenic peptides generated by endosomes and cytosolic processes overlap to a surprising degree. Furthermore, they demonstrate that the form of antigen administered can influence immunodominance hierarchies and that exogenous-antigen vaccines can induce broad and balanced T(CD8+) responses.
Article.ArticleTitle: Heat-aggregated noninfectious influenza virus induces a more balanced CD8(+)-T-lymphocyte immunodominance hierarchy than infectious virus.
Article.Affiliations: Laboratory of Viral Diseases, National Institute of Allergy and Infectious Diseases, National Institutes of Health, Bethesda, Maryland 20892, USA.
Article.ArticleMeshHeadingsList: Animals; Antigen Presentation(immunology); Antigens, Viral(immunology); CD8-Positive T-Lymphocytes(immunology); Cell Line; Dendritic Cells; Hot Temperature; Humans; Immunodominant Epitopes(immunology); Influenza A virus(immunology; pathogenicity); Influenza Vaccines(immunology); Influenza, Human(prevention & control); Mice; Mice, Inbred BALB C; Mice, Inbred C57BL; Spleen(cytology; immunology); Tumor Cells, Cultured

Immunization.ImmunizationComments: At least 30 days post immunization, splenocytes were collected. Thioglycollate-induced PEC are used as APC. Epitope specific CD8+ cells were obtained by incubation with peptide pulsed irradiated EL-4 cells in the presence IL-2 (10U/ml).

AssayInformation.AssayComments: An epitope specific CD8<sup>+</sup> T cell line is stimulated by incubation with virus infected PEC. Congruently with the cytosolic generation of the epitope in those conditions, the addition of β<sub>2</sub>m to the culture generates lower levels of stimulation and infected TAP-/- PEC don’t induce significant stimulation.

Immunization.ImmunizationComments: 1wk post immunization, thioglycollate-induced PEC were collected.

AssayInformation.AssayComments: Peritoneal CD8<sup>+</sup>, IFN-γ<sup>+</sup> cells are induced by incubation with peptide loaded DC-like cell line DC2.4, when derived from infectious virus injected animals, congruently with the known immunodominance of this epitope. Splenocytes are significantly less stimulated than PEC.

Immunization.ImmunizationComments: At least 30 days post immunization, splenocytes were collected. Thioglycollate-induced PEC are used as APC. Epitope specific CD8+ cells were obtained by incubation with peptide pulsed irradiated EL-4 cells in the presence IL-2 (10U/ml).

AssayInformation.AssayComments: An epitope specific CD8<sup>+</sup> T cell line is stimulated by incubation with boiled-virus incubated PEC. Congruently with the endosomal generation of the epitope in those conditions, the addition of β<sub>2</sub>m to the culture enhances the levels of stimulation, while boiled virus-exposed TAP-/- PEC reduce the levels of stimulation only 5 fold (which is the amount seen to correlate with the reduced expression of MHC I molecules on the post-Golgi compartment, but not further reduced due to TAP involvement in this particular peptide presentation). The endosomal generation of this epitope was further proved by incubation with phagocitosis inhibitors.

Immunization.ImmunizationComments: Virus was boiled 10 min at 100°C. 1wk post immunization, thioglycollate-induced PEC were collected.

AssayInformation.AssayComments: Peritoneal CD8<sup>+</sup>, IFN-γ<sup>+</sup> cells are induced in low but significant levels by incubation with peptide loaded DC-like cell line DC2.4, when derived from non-infectious, boiled virus-injected animals (where epitopes are generated through endosomal presentation). Those levels are below the stimulation level conferred to cells from infectious virus injected animals (which would use the classical cytosolic pathway). The non-infective boiled virus generates actually a response more balanced among the different hierarchies of epitopes known to be recognized upon infection, but which is not directed (at least strongly) to novel specificities. This implies an overlap in the epitopes generated by the two pathways, which is confirmed by stimulation of this lymphocytes by virus infected cells. Splenocytes are stimulated to a lesser extent than PEC.

Immunization.ImmunizationComments: Virus was boiled 10 min at 100°C. 1wk post immunization, thioglycollate-induced PEC were collected.

AssayInformation.AssayComments: Peritoneal CD8<sup>+</sup>, IFN-γ<sup>+</sup> cells are induced in low but significant levels by incubation with peptide loaded DC-like cell line DC2.4, when derived from non-infectious, boiled virus-injected animals (where epitopes are generated through endosomal presentation).Those levels are higher than the stimulation conferred to cells from infectious virus injected animals (which would use the classical cytosolic pathway). The non-infective boiled virus generates then a response more balanced among the different hierarchies of epitopes known to be recognized upon infection, but which is not directed (at least strongly) to novel specificities. This implies an overlap in the epitopes generated by the two pathways, which is confirmed by stimulation of this lymphocytes by virus infected cells. Splenocytes are stimulated to a lesser extent than PEC.

Immunization.ImmunizationComments: 1wk post immunization, thioglycollate-induced PEC were collected.

AssayInformation.AssayComments: Peritoneal CD8<sup>+</sup>, IFN-γ<sup>+</sup> cells are not induced by incubation with peptide loaded DC-like cell line DC2.4, when derived from infectious virus injected animals, congruently with the known subdominant nature of this epitope. Splenocytes are similarly not stimulated.

Epitope.EpitopeComments: A.k.a. RNA-directed RNA polymerase subunit P1.

The non-infective boiled virus generates then a response more balanced among the different hierarchies of epitopes known to be recognized upon infection, but which is not directed (at least strongly) to novel specificities. This implies an overlap in the epitopes generated by the two pathways, which is confirmed by stimulation of this lymphocytes by virus infected cells. Splenocytes are stimulated to a lesser extent than PEC.

Epitope.EpitopeComments: The manuscript states the peptide used is PB1 703-712, which has been corrected by the authors to PB1 703-711 in a personal communication. A.k.a. RNA-directed RNA polymerase subunit P1.

Epitope.EpitopeComments: The manuscript states the peptide used is PB2 198-207, which has been corrected by the authors to PB2 198-206 in a personal communication. A.k.a.RNA-directed RNA polymerase subunit P3.

Immunization.ImmunizationComments: Virus was boiled 10 min at 100°C. 1wk post immunization, thioglycollate-induced PEC were collected.

AssayInformation.AssayComments: Peritoneal CD8<sup>+</sup>, IFN-γ<sup>+</sup> cells are induced in low but significant levels by incubation with peptide loaded DC-like cell line DC2.4, when derived from non-infectious, boiled virus-injected animals (where epitopes are generated through endosomal presentation).Those levels are higher than the stimulation conferred to cells from infectious virus injected animals (which would use the classical cytosolic pathway). The non-infective boiled virus generates then a response more balanced among the different hierarchies of epitopes known to be recognized upon infection, but which is not directed (at least strongly) to novel specificities. This implies an overlap in the epitopes generated by the two pathways, which is confirmed by stimulation of this lymphocytes by virus infected cells. Immunization.ImmunizationComments: 1wk post immunization, thioglycollate-induced PEC were collected.

AssayInformation.AssayComments: Peritoneal CD8<sup>+</sup>, IFN-γ<sup>+</sup> cells are induced by incubation with peptide loaded DC-like cell line DC2.4, when derived from infectious virus injected animals, congruently with the known dominant nature of this epitope. Splenocytes are stimulated to a lesser extent.

Immunization.ImmunizationComments: Virus was boiled 10 min at 100°C. 1wk post immunization, thioglycollate-induced PEC were collected.

AssayInformation.AssayComments: Peritoneal CD8<sup>+</sup>, IFN-γ<sup>+</sup> cells are induced in low but significant levels by incubation with peptide loaded DC-like cell line DC2.4, when derived from non-infectious, boiled virus-injected animals (where epitopes are generated through endosomal presentation).Those levels are lower than the stimulation conferred to cells from infectious virus injected animals (which would use the classical cytosolic pathway). The non-infective boiled virus generates then a response more balanced among the different hierarchies of epitopes known to be recognized upon infection, but which is not directed (at least strongly) to novel specificities. This implies an overlap in the epitopes generated by the two pathways, which is confirmed by stimulation of this lymphocytes by virus infected cells. Splenocytes are stimulated to a lesser extent than PEC.

Immunization.ImmunizationComments: Virus was boiled 10 min at 100°C. 1wk post immunization, splenocytes were collected for in vitro stimulation. Splenocytes were incubated for 7 days in the presence of autologous influenza infected splenocytes.

AssayInformation.AssayComments: CD8<sup>+</sup> splenocytes effectively lyse peptide loaded P815 target cells, when derived from non-infectious, boiled virus-injected animals (where epitopes are generated through endosomal presentation).The level is anyway lower than the one obtained with cells from infectious virus injected animals (which would use the classical cytosolic pathway). The non-infective boiled virus generates a response where the different hierarchies of epitopes known to be recognized upon infection (NP 147-155 > HA 518-526 > NP 38-47 = NP 218-226) is altered to NP 38-47 = NP147-155 > HA 518-526.

Immunization.ImmunizationComments: 1wk post immunization, splenocytes were collected for in vitro stimulation. Splenocytes were incubated for 7 days in the presence of autologous influenza infected splenocytes.

AssayInformation.AssayComments: CD8<sup>+</sup> splenocytes effectively lyse peptide loaded P815 target cells, when derived from infectious virus injected animals, congruently with the known dominant nature of this epitope. The different hierarchies of epitopes known to be recognized upon infection (NP 147-155 > HA 518-526 > NP 38-47 = NP 218-226) are seen also in this system.

Immunization.ImmunizationComments: Virus was boiled 10 min at 100°C. 1wk post immunization, splenocytes were collected for in vitro stimulation. Splenocytes were incubated for 7 days in the presence of autologous influenza infected splenocytes.

AssayInformation.AssayComments: CD8<sup>+</sup> splenocytes are not able to lyse peptide loaded P815 target cells, when derived from non-infectious, boiled virus-injected animals (where epitopes are generated through endosomal presentation). The non-infective boiled virus generates a response where the different hierarchies of epitopes known to be recognized upon infection (NP 147-155 > HA 518-526 > NP 38-47 = NP 218-226) is altered to NP 38-47 = NP147-155 > HA 518-526.

Immunization.ImmunizationComments: 1wk post immunization, splenocytes were collected for in vitro stimulation. Splenocytes were incubated for 7 days in the presence of autologous influenza infected splenocytes.

AssayInformation.AssayComments: CD8<sup>+</sup> splenocytes lyse peptide loaded P815 target cells, when derived from infectious virus injected animals. The level of this reaction is congruent with the subdominant nature of this epitope. The different hierarchies of epitopes known to be recognized upon infection (NP 147-155 > HA 518-526 > NP 38-47 = NP 218-226) are seen also in this system.

Epitope.EpitopeComments: The manuscript states the peptide used is NP 39-47, but the authors' provided sequence is actually for NP 38-47.

The level is anyway lower than the one obtained with cells from infectious virus injected animals (which would use the classical cytosolic pathway). The non-infective boiled virus generates a response where the different hierarchies of epitopes known to be recognized upon infection (NP 147-155 > HA 518-526 > NP 38-47 = NP 218-226) is altered to NP 38-47 = NP147-155 > HA 518-526.

Epitope.EpitopeComments: The manuscript states the peptide used is HA 518-528 but the authors' provided sequence is actually for HA 514-522, not considering the signal peptide or HA 533-541 including it. Swiss-prot entry includes the 17-aa signal peptide.
